snippet.textDisplay: I love you I love you I love you I love you I love you. I have a similar relationship with my mom as you do with your dad, but it's not nearly as rough as you have it. snippet.textDisplay: Oh, Hannah. This is heartbreaking. I was raised as a JW too and it has caused me trauma that I am still working through as an adult. I wasn’t baptized either but I went to District Conventions, Memorial Services and the Kingdom Hall every Sunday. In school I was isolated because of my religion since I wasn’t allowed to participate in birthdays or holiday events. I was taught that being queer was wrong so it took me years to accept that part of myself. You’re not alone. It is a horrible organization and I’m sorry your dad and step-mom can’t see past their own beliefs.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh, Hannah. This is heartbreaking. I was raised as a JW too and it has caused me trauma that I am still working through as an adult. I wasn’t baptized either but I went to District Conventions, Memorial Services and the Kingdom Hall every Sunday. In school I was isolated because of my religion since I wasn’t allowed to participate in birthdays or holiday events. I was taught that being queer was wrong so it took me years to accept that part of myself. You’re not alone. It is a horrible organization and I’m sorry your dad and step-mom can’t see past their own beliefs.

snippet.textDisplay: I mean it depends on the person I truly feel that the jehovah witnesses take there religion so serious and I feel you dont have to follow all there rules exactly as they are. Cause there rules are strict on the part that you need to stay away from the peopel that supposedly make mistakes. Still, I feel that they should not be strict on the part of not being able to talk to family members who are gay. They too have some things that they are not doing correctly just like any other religion and they are just way to blind to see it. I bet jehovah is not ok with that part  cause he loves us and he know that we cant do anything about this bisexual desease. If there was a cure to stop being gay the whole thing changes but he knows there is not and I'm sure he can tolerate us with just some flaws (still I feel all religions are misinterpreting a part of the bible condemning gay people). There are other things that I do stand for that the jehovah witness are strict on and that is "not being able to tolerate people who had had infidelity". Now I can say that is more worse than other things. Let's just all remember that jehovah or if you believe in jesus as the main God that he knows that we cant do anything about being gay.

snippet.textDisplay:
I got married two years ago. I am not gay, so it's nowhere near the same thing, but my in-laws were (are? maybe?) not invested in my married life with my wife. They are Southern Baptist devout Republicans, and I am an atheist Social Democrat.... so yea, we don't talk much. My wife has grown out of the "cult-like" upbringing that she had, and she hasn't even told them, which is almost sadder. But - to the point.

We had a medieval wedding, we had a handfasting, and never mentioned God. They were furious. My father-in-law walked my wife down the aisle talking about traffic and random stuff, and ruined the entire moment. The entire family/side left after food had been eaten, and we knew that it would happen.

My Groomsman told me later that the point of a wedding was to bring people together to celebrate the occasion, to celebrate US, and to help US celebrate with our nearest and dearest that we wanted to celebrate with. That actually helped me. If there are people that don't want to be there because they don't support you, then they don't need to be there. Be vain about it - you're allowed to be. Enjoy your time with your friends and family, celebrate yours' and Ella's new life, HAVE WINE (if you want to)!! I promise - the people nearest and dearest to you will make it a spectacular occasion no matter what.

Know that myself and your fans support you in everything, and nuptial congratulations! <3
snippet.textOriginal:
I got married two years ago.  I am not gay, so it's nowhere near the same thing, but my in-laws were (are?  maybe?) not invested in my married life with my wife.  They are Southern Baptist devout Republicans, and I am an atheist Social Democrat.... so yea, we don't talk much.  My wife has grown out of the "cult-like" upbringing that she had, and she hasn't even told them, which is almost sadder.  But - to the point.

 We had a medieval wedding, we had a handfasting, and never mentioned God.  They were furious.  My father-in-law walked my wife down the aisle talking about traffic and random stuff, and ruined the entire moment.  The entire family/side left after food had been eaten, and we knew that it would happen.

My Groomsman told me later that the point of a wedding was to bring people together to celebrate the occasion, to celebrate US, and to help US celebrate with our nearest and dearest that we wanted to celebrate with.  That actually helped me.  If there are people that don't want to be there because they don't support you, then they don't need to be there.  Be vain about it - you're allowed to be.  Enjoy your time with your friends and family, celebrate yours' and Ella's new life, HAVE WINE (if you want to)!!  I promise - the people nearest and dearest to you will make it a spectacular occasion no matter what.

Know that myself and your fans support you in everything, and nuptial congratulations!  <3

snippet.textDisplay:
Hannah, I cannot imagine how this must feel. There is nothing I can say to help or make it better. You are completely allowed to feel how you feel and grieve over it and just plain old feel shitty. But I also know that there is a huge number of people who love and support you and who will support you in all that you do. It's not the same as a dad.
You are right when you say you've done nothing wrong. This is not your fault. And for some reason, it always makes me believe it more when someone else says it so here's yet another supporter coming here to say you are loved. We love you for who you are and who you love and I hope you will take all the time and privacy and everything else that you need to hopefully, eventually, feel less shitty. 
We love you.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I'm leaving a Mennonite church. Same thing there. My parents will never eat at the same table with me again. They will never shake my hand again. They will never come to my wedding. It sucks. I feel for you.

snippet.textDisplay:
I’m so sorry that you’ve been put in this position.
You can still be hurt and sad even if you expected this. It doesn’t have to be logical. He’s your dad and it’s his job to support you and cheer you on. You’re very brave to share how you feel with everyone and I hope you believe all of the great things you said in this video for yourself too. But remember, it’s isn’t a failure if it hurts. Sending so much strength and support and love your way. I wish I had a better relationship with my dad too, but I’m so so thankful that my mom supports me as hard as two parents.☀️
snippet.textOriginal:
I’m so sorry that you’ve been put in this position. 
You can still be hurt and sad even if you expected this. It doesn’t have to be logical. He’s your dad and it’s his job to support you and cheer you on. You’re very brave to share how you feel with everyone and I hope you believe all of the great things you said in this video for yourself too. But remember, it’s isn’t a failure if it hurts. Sending so much strength and support and love your way. I wish I had a better relationship with my dad too, but I’m so so thankful that my mom supports me as hard as two parents.☀️

snippet.textDisplay: My heart absolutely breaks for you, and for you grieving the relationship you should’ve been entitled to with your father. I am not you and don’t want to put words in your mouth but I can imagine him officially choosing the cult over you in this way might feel a lot like a death. Let yourself grieve but don’t forget just how many people love you.
snippet.textOriginal: My heart absolutely breaks for you, and for you grieving the relationship you should’ve been entitled to with your father. I am not you and don’t want to put words in your mouth but I can imagine him officially choosing the cult over you in this way might feel a lot like a death. Let yourself grieve but don’t forget just how many people love you.

snippet.textDisplay: Having both my parent choose drugs over me and my siblings, these feeling are so real and close to my home. And its wonderful to see the strength but also the pain because as time goes on youll believe that "you're over it" and when the past still hurts it makes me feel so pathetic and its really empowering to see other strong women still hurt about things they've "overcome". Love you♡
snippet.textOriginal: Having both my parent choose drugs over me and my siblings, these feeling are so real and close to my home. And its wonderful to see the strength but also the pain because as time goes on youll believe that "you're over it" and when the past still hurts it makes me feel so pathetic and its really empowering to see other strong women still hurt about things they've "overcome". Love you♡

snippet.textDisplay:
TRIGGER WARNING:
I know how you feel. I yelled at my dad the other day because he has very nasty thoughts about little girls (he’s basically a pedo) and he said “at least they’re the opposite sex”. Basically implying that being gay is more disgusting then saying sexual things about 6 to 17 year old girls. And I was so surprised that that hurt me so badly even though I KNOW that’s how he thinks. I always knew. But still, hearing those words hurts so much.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not going to watch this because I don't feel like crying I don't know who you are or what does YouTube pays about I only saw it on the trending. But I'm going to take an educated guess that you are LGBT or something correct me if I'm wrong. I may not be the most open-minded individual at times, but if your father refused to go to your wedding because of what I think it is then he is deeply going to regret it. Whatever happened to unconditional love? As a conservative individual seeing somebody disown their children or do anything hateful towards their children because of their sexual identity pisses me off. Because the child didn't ask to be put into this world. If I had a child and it decided to come out as trans I may not be the most accepting of transgenders but because of my unconditional love for my own flesh and blood I would have been accepted it. You are crying because you loved your father and that's only normal. He doesn't understand but soon enough he will, he will have to answer to God for this . but never stop being you. God bless and have a great day

You are crying because you loved your father and that's only normal. He doesn't understand but soon enough he will, he will have to answer to God for this . but never stop being you. God bless and have a great day

snippet.textDisplay: You ask your self why you’re surprised that he chose the witnesses over you again...it’s probably more like “how much longer are you going to miss my wonderful moments and reject the happiness that is also your happiness?” Why anyone would do that is just beyond my comprehension. I wish you and your future wifey a wonderful life full of happiness that you two can share together forever. If/when others (whoever they may be) decide to share your happiness through love and support, then that’s just icing on the cake girl. If not, that’s fine. You don’t need it!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm going through something very similar right now. My parents aren't JW but they are very devout Christians, to the point that they refuse to meet my fiance and every time I make a trip home my relationship with my father worsens as he demands I argue with him and basically "prove" to him how I can justify being in a relationship with a woman knowing that it's a "sin." I am so sorry that your dad continues to choose his beliefs over you, your love is beautiful, you've done nothing wrong, and you're not alone. Sending you and Ella so much love <3

snippet.textDisplay: I grew up in a Christian Reformed house and my parents are extremely conservative and make disgusting statements against the LGBT community and I am so scared to come out even though I am now an adult. I know that shitty feeling from understanding that your parents love for you isn’t unconditional, but is dependent on your ability to do and be what they want. Especially when you love them unconditionally and want a relationship with them. Thank you for making this video and reminding me that I’m not alone. We love you and support you ❤️

snippet.textDisplay: Hannah, you are so strong and so brave and deserving of so much love. I’m so sorry you’re going through this suffering and pain. Keep being your beautiful self, you deserve all the unconditional love in the world. Thank you for speaking out, thank you for sharing your pain, I know how incredibly hard it is. Your feelings resonate as someone who lost a relationship to their parent to mental illnesses I feel your grief and pain over not feeling that support and love from a parent you so desperately want to have. I hope that you can find comfort in the love and hope you bring to the world and that your wedding will be a beautiful day surrounded by the people who love you and support you. 💜

I hope that you can find comfort in the love and hope you bring to the world and that your wedding will be a beautiful day surrounded by the people who love you and support you. 💜

snippet.textDisplay:
I was born and raised a JW, and stayed til I was 38. Today my mother has almost no contact with me. One of the biggest sorrows of my life. But I had to live this life, when I realized that the life I had believed in wasn’t true. Today I am happily bisexual and polyamorous, and my life is full of people who love me unconditionally. Because that is what TRUE love is. Unconditional.

Sin is a concept that is only true to those who cannot see the whole picture. The rest of us are able to see that love is all that matters.

I wish you both a wonderful wedding despite everything, and I wish you many years of love. Many hugs from Sweden! ❤️
snippet.textOriginal:

Because that is what TRUE love is. Unconditional. 

Sin is a concept that is only true to those who cannot see the whole picture. The rest of us are able to see that love is all that matters. 

I wish you both a wonderful wedding despite everything, and I wish you many years of love. Many hugs from Sweden! ❤️

snippet.textDisplay:
You misunderstand.

It is not their choice, people in the organization do not get real choices, they act according to their beliefs and these are dictated by the organization.

This has nothing to do with you and there is nothing you can do to change the situation. This is your pity but also your relief, because if your father loves you, then you should know he cannot speak it, but that his love is not being hidden from you, but from the organization.

Jesus is right you know, when he says that those who love their father and mother more then him are not worthy of him, but people often misunderstand.

Forgive your father, for that is righteousness and worth loving.

Mind yourself that he also may be suffering, even though it is secret. In or out, as long as a loved one is on the inside, both are prisoners.

snippet.textDisplay:
Tell this story on Ellen somehow. Get Ellen involved. Jehovah’s Witnesses are one huge steaming ball of humanitarian rights violations.

—They destroy families in many ways.
—They allow themselves and indoctrinated children to sometimes die rather than accepting blood.
—they shun family members who have officially left or been removed for “sins” like being gay or celebrating Christmas.
—they discourage education.
—they use fear (of Armageddon) and guilt to manipulate their members and do the same for their children. Currently about to build a gigantic advertising media complex to make better propaganda for their kids.

It’s an extremely controlling authoritarian culty steaming pile of doo doo, whose hobby is predicting the end of the world.

—They destroy families in many ways.  
—They allow themselves and indoctrinated children to sometimes die rather than accepting blood. 
—they shun family members who have officially left or been removed for “sins” like being gay or celebrating Christmas.  
—they discourage education. 
—they use fear (of Armageddon) and guilt to manipulate their members and do the same for their children.  Currently about to build a gigantic advertising media complex to make better propaganda for their kids. 

It’s an extremely controlling authoritarian culty steaming pile of doo doo, whose hobby is predicting the end of the world.

Michelle

snippet.textDisplay: I know how you feel. My bioloical dad CHOSE not to be a dad to me. He walked out the door when I was 6 months old. I was raised by another, the most amazing person. The reason I am who I am today. And when he died, my world crashed around me. My bioloical dad decided 20+ years later he wanted to return and be a dad... you dont get to CHOOSE when you want to be in your kids life and when its convenient for you. I had a dad. And he will always be my dad. My heart and love goes out to you. Lean on your partner and her love. Because she loves you for who YOU are.

And he will always be my dad. My heart and love goes out to you. Lean on your partner and her love. Because she loves you for who YOU are.

snippet.textDisplay: Wow... I have never watched your channel but you are a strong woman. You are right there is nothing wrong with you and you are worthy, they are the ones that are sick. I dont understand how religion is above the law, that doesn't make sense at all but it's the way of the world I guess. We can only hope those laws will change in our futures. We can only hope people will see the neglect and terror the cults puts people through and continues even after they leave. This is why organized religion is dangerous. It must have been and still is extremely hard on you growing up with a leader in the jw. Be thankful you are a smart, strong and caring woman, even though you grew up in that mess. I am thankful you saw the light and got out of the cult. You are different for a reason and if your father doesn't understand that or why, he doesn't deserve to know the happiness and joyfulness of your lifes journey. We all know these types of situations never get easier but instead of being in a messed up situation it will become a small distant memory. I am glad you were strong enough to share your story. Even if your 10 minute long video helps one person it was worth posting your story. I hope you have a beautiful wedding and stay strong.

snippet.textDisplay: All of us who grew up in JW households know from the very beginning that we are not a priority in our parents lives.
snippet.textOriginal: All of us who grew up in JW households know from the very beginning that we are not a priority in our parents lives.

snippet.textDisplay: Genuine unconditional love does NOT judge. I refuse to keep people in my life who don’t accept that I’m a Woman-Loving-Woman. I know MY love for another is real. I love my family even though some can’t love me as I was born, as I am. You have NOTHING to be ashamed of. God Made us who we are - it is scientifically proven in The Journal of American Medicine from several brain autopsies done as a collaborative study that those of us who are gay were born with a Gay gene. It is part of our foundation. So when someone claiming to be religious chooses to not accept me as I was Created by my loving God then to me that person is a hypocrite. I’ve learned to love some people from a distance because I won’t tolerate someone telling me who to love or how to live. THEY wouldn’t put up with anyone trying to force something on THEM, right? So why should We tolerate THEIR trying to force rhetoric and judgement on US? Keep loving your father because believe it or not, HE needs it more than you can possibly imagine. I’ll be praying that he opens his Heart to allow God’s Unconditional Love to heal what he’s losing by not accepting you. God Bless you and your sweetheart!

It is part of our foundation. So when someone claiming to be religious chooses to not accept me as I was Created by my loving God then to me that person is a hypocrite. I’ve learned to love some people from a distance because I won’t tolerate someone telling me who to love or how to live. THEY wouldn’t put up with anyone trying to force something on THEM, right? So why should We tolerate THEIR trying to force rhetoric and judgement on US? Keep loving your father because believe it or not, HE needs it more than you can possibly imagine. I’ll be praying that he opens his Heart to allow God’s Unconditional Love to heal what he’s losing by not accepting you. God Bless you and your sweetheart!

snippet.textDisplay: I would definitely agree with you on Jehovah's Witnesses being a cult. I always enjoy when my doorbell gets rung and I  get to bring up their belief on only 144,000 people go to Heaven. This more than anything else underscores the principle of context. Anytime you take the TEXT out of CONTEXT you get CONNED every single time. If only 144,000 people are going to Heaven, then that excludes the majority of members of said cult. That's a giant size hole in your ideology.

snippet.textDisplay: I know this comment will be lost in a sea of fans. I'm not a fan. I'm not an un-fan, I'm not not familiar with this young woman aside from her appearance on GMM and in Calm Down. I am so a Christian, having said that, this video broke my heart. So I am going to frame my comment directly to Ms Hart. I am a Christian, and a mother. I start with that because it's a part of who I am. But I also have love bursting out of my chest daily for all people. Black, white, gay, straight, whatever. I as a Christian, chose to love, regardless. If my son came to me today, and said he's gay, well, I would be at first surprised, but NOTHING, could make me love him less, least of all who he chooses to love. I know this hurts baby, and I wish I could help you. You seem like a sweet sweet gal. Lean on those who accept you, who love you and dance your a$$ off at that wedding. I am sending all my prayers and love to you today.

So I am going to frame my comment directly to Ms Hart. I am a Christian, and a mother. I start with that because it's a part of who I am. But I also have love bursting out of my chest daily for all people. Black, white, gay, straight, whatever. I as a Christian, chose to love, regardless. If my son came to me today, and said he's gay, well, I would be at first surprised, but NOTHING, could make me love him less, least of all who he chooses to love. I know this hurts baby, and I wish I could help you. You seem like a sweet sweet gal. Lean on those who accept you, who love you and dance your a$$ off at that wedding. I am sending all my prayers and love to you today.
